description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. 19 lines per page. Written in medium small taʻlīq in black ink with use of red for "qawluh". European paper with watermark. Illuminated headpiece (ʻunwān) in gold, blue and white on fol. 1b. The text is framed within one red line (gold and black on fol. 1b-2a). Marginal annotations by several hands. Fol. 463-465: Blank. On fol. ii-iv: Table of contents in a grid in red ink. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including Kabīkaj. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl 27(?)". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1069". Copy completed in the beginning of Jumādá al-Ākhirah 995 [May 1587] (colophon, fol. 462b). Incipit: الحمد لله على شمول نعمه الجسام ... وبعد فان ارباب العقل متطابقون واصحاب النقل متوافقون على انّ العلم وان تشعّبت افانيته ... [2ب] ... قوله الحمد لله الذى احكم بكتابه اصول الشريعة الغرّآء اه الاحكام الاتقان والكتاب فى اللغة كالكتب والكتابة مصدر كتب Explicit: ترك السقوط ولا يجوز ان يكون سقوط فى الجملة بالاعذار ولا يجوز سقوط حرمة تركها فى الجملة بالاعذار هذا آخر ما اردنا ايراده فى حواشى الكتاب مستعينا بالملك الوهاب والحمد لله ربّ العالمين والصلوة على سيّدنا محمد وآله واصحابه اجمعين
author: Fanārī, Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad Shāh, 1436 or 7-1481 or 2.
abstract: Gloss on Talwīḥ fī kashf ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanqīḥ, a commentary by Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftazānī (d. 791/1389) on Tanqīḥ al-uṣūl, a treatise on uṣūl al-fiqh by ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Masʻūd al-Maḥbūbī (d. 747/1346).
extent: v + 465 leaves: paper ; 208 x 142 (145 x 75) mm. bound to 215 x 150 mm.
provenance: Several ownership statements, some with seal, on fol. 1a, in the name of ʻAbd al-Laṭīf ibn ibrāhīm Aqshahrī, dated 1110 H. [1698 or 9] ; Miftāḥ al-Dīn ibn Husām al-Dīn al-Bukhārī, with seal dated 1247 H. [1831 or 2] ; Ḥusayn ibn Bayram(?), dated 1274 [1857 or 8], with mention of the price ; Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir, dated Jumādá al-Ākhirah 1286 [Sept.-Oct., 1869]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: Fanārī, Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad Shāh, 1436 or 7-1481 or 2.

subject: Taftāzānī, Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar, 1322-1389?—Talwīḥ fī kashf ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanqīḥ—Commentaries—15th century
binding_note: Quarter bound in kakhi, with a blind stamped panel on upper and lower covers. Leather spine with four raised bands, with gilt stamps and rolls.
